timeAnchors.definition: Study entry and the start of symptom assessment
timeAnchors.sourceText: at study entry (‘Day 1’ symptom count starts from the first day of symptoms), plus the presence of select symptoms within 24 hours prior to Day 1.

repetitions.sourceText: Participant-reported symptom diary Daily through Day 29
Participant-reported symptom reminder Daily through Day 29

repetitions.exitCondition: Completion of first 4 days after IMP administration
repetitions.sourceText: the sentinel group will be contacted daily (in-person or by telephone) for the first 4 days after IMP administration
Telephone contact for safety monitoring Daily

repetitions.exitCondition: Dosing of second participant in sentinel group
repetitions.sourceText: At each site, there will be an interval of 24 hours after dosing of the first participant in the sentinel group before the next participant can be dosed.

Following screening, and no more than 7 days (‘Day 1’ symptom count starts from the first day of symptoms) from self-reported onset of COVID-19-related symptoms or measured fever, participants will receive a single dose of IMP.

traversalConstraints.sourceText: [{'condition': 'Subject experiences AE or SAE', 'path': ['AE_REPORTING', 'FOLLOW_UP_UNTIL_RESOLUTION']}, {'condition': 'Early Termination or Withdrawal', 'path': ['EARLY_DISCONTINUATION_VISIT']}]

executionTypes.rationale: Initial evaluation to determine eligibility performed only once at the start of the study.
Continuous monitoring for events until the data cut-off of 30 days after 43 events are confirmed.
Determination of the specific date of symptom onset used to define the early intervention analysis set.
One-time assessment at baseline to define the seronegative analysis set.
Standard clinical trial assessments performed at scheduled study visits as indicated in the Schedule of Activities.

footnoteConditions.text: a. Visits noted P/H can be performed either in-person at clinical site or at home depending on the participant's clinical status, availability of safe transfer to sites (eg, to avoid risk of infection spread), and local guidelines for travel restrictions/social distancing. For home visits, a nurse or HCP trained on study procedures will visit the participant at home; nasal swabs, blood collection (where at-home collection is possible), and inspection of injection sites will be performed by the nurse or HCP. Nurse or HCP will ensure shipment of specimens collected and reporting of AEs to study sites.
footnoteConditions.structuredCondition: location.choice(in-person, home) IF (participant_status == 'unstable' OR travel_restricted == true)

footnoteConditions.text: q. If evidence of injection site reaction persists at the Day 6 visit, the injection site will be rechecked at each visit until no evidence of an active reaction remains.
footnoteConditions.sourceText: q. If evidence of injection site reaction persists at the Day 6 visit, the injection site will be re

footnoteConditions.text: r. The first 20 participants dosed (ie, the sentinel group) will undergo safety monitoring for 4 hours post IMP administration before further participants are dosed. At each site, there will be an interval of 24 hours after dosing of the first participant in the sentinel group before the next participant can be dosed. The next 80 participants (21 to 100) will then undergo safety monitoring for 2 hours post IMP administration, otherwise the minimum safety monitoring time will be 1 hour. In addition, the sentinel group will be contacted daily (in-person or by telephone) for the first 4 days after IMP administration. Contact will be made by telephone on days when there is not an in-person visit.

endpointAlgorithms.name: Primary: Severe COVID-19 or Death from any cause
endpointAlgorithms.algorithm: IF (death = TRUE) OR ((pneumonia = TRUE OR hypoxemia = TRUE) AND WHO_score >= 5) THEN 'Event' ELSE 'No Event'
endpointAlgorithms.successCriteria: A participant is classified as having the endpoint if they experience severe COVID-19 or death from any cause through Day 29.
endpointAlgorithms.sourceText: The primary efficacy endpoint is a composite of either severe COVID-19 or death from any cause through Day 29. Severe COVID-19 is characterized by a minimum of either pneumonia (fever, cough, tachypne

endpointAlgorithms.name: Relative Risk Reduction (RRR)
endpointAlgorithms.algorithm: RRR = 1 - (Incidence in AZD7442 / Incidence in Placebo)
endpointAlgorithms.successCriteria: RRR not equal to zero (statistically significant difference between treatment groups).
endpointAlgorithms.sourceText: Efficacy will be calculated as the RRR, defined as 1-Relative Risk. The null hypothesis is that the RRR of severe COVID-19 or death from any cause through Day 29 in participants on AZD7442 compared wi

derivedVariables.name: Key Secondary Composite Endpoint
sourceVariables: Hospitalization for COVID-19 complications or sequelae
derivedVariables.derivationRule: Binary indicator (Yes/No) if either death from any cause OR hospitalization for COVID-19 complications/sequelae occurs

derivedVariables.name: Relative Risk Reduction (RRR) of Key Secondary Endpoint
derivedVariables.derivationRule: Calculated based on the proportion of events in AZD7442 vs placebo at Day 169

derivedVariables.name: Time to death or first hospitalization
derivedVariables.derivationRule: Min(Date of Death, Date of first Hospitalization) - Date of IMP administration
derivedVariables.imputationRule: Kaplan-Meier censoring for participants without events

derivedVariables.name: Proportion of participants with respiratory failure
derivedVariables.derivationRule: Binary indicator (Yes/No) if any of the source requirements are met

derivedVariables.name: Progression of COVID-19-associated symptoms
derivedVariables.derivationRule: One or more symptoms progressing to a worse status than recorded in the diary entry prior to start of IMP
derivedVariables.baselineDefinition: Symptom status recorded in diary prior to start of AZD7442 or placebo

derivedVariables.name: Undetectable SARS-CoV-2 over time
derivedVariables.derivationRule: Time from Day 1 to the first instance where SARS-CoV-2 is undetectable
